title: Jennifer Arcuri refuses to deny sex with Boris Johnson in bombshell TV interview
text:

Jennifer Arcuri today refused seven times to deny having a sexual relationship with Boris Johnson in a bombshell first TV interview.

His former pal swerved the question in an eye-popping exchange on ITV's Good Morning Britain as she denied getting "favours" from the former London Mayor.

Tech guru and former model Ms Arcuri exploded into headlines last month after it emerged was given access to three foreign trade trips and had Mr Johnson speak at four of her events when he was London mayor.

Mr Johnson has 24 hours to provide details of their relationship to a conflict-of-interests probe in the London Assembly - whose rules forbid favourable treatment to friends.

Despite the privileged access - which began after they met in October 2011 - Ms Arcuri today insisted "Boris never ever gave me favouritism".

But she repeatedly refused to deny claims by acquaintances that they had a sexual relationship.

(Image: ITV)

She also refused to say how many times Mr Johnson visited her Shoreditch flat, which contained an office and a pole-dancing pole - saying only it was a "handful".

Ms Acrcuri said "yes he saw the pole" and jokingly refused to say if Mr Johnson danced on the pole himself, saying: "I’m never never going to tell you that."

Asked if they had an intimate relationship, she told ITV's Good Morning Britain: "It’s categorically no one’s business what private life we had, or didn’t have."

Asked again, she snapped at host Piers Morgan: "Do you want me to talk about your sex life? Because I would love to ask you a few questions."

(Image: ITV)

And she said: "Because the press have made me this objectified ex-model pole dancer, I really am not going to answer that question.

"I’m not going to put myself in a position for you to weaponise my answer. I'm being used as a pawn."

She added: "The first initial reaction is to deny everything... but then when I saw the way I'm objectified, and dragged through the press with all these misquotes and interpretations of who I am, I can't believe... if I'd looked a different way, or I was a man, I wouldn't be objectified."

Good Morning Britain persisted in asking, saying it was not about objectification but "politics and influence" and was "clearly relevant" to alleged impropriety. But she said: "I’m not answering, that’s my record."

She said the question was not relevant, saying: "Categorically, Boris had nothing to do with all my other achievements".

Asked if she loved the former London mayor, Ms Arcuri said: "I’ve been asked that many times.

"I care about him deeply as a friend and we do share a very close bond.

"But I wish him well. I want him to be happy. I wish Carrie well. And I really do want him to focus on making Britain great again."

Ms Acruri gained access to three trade missions Mr Johnson led in 2014 and 2015, while Mayor of London. She was also given £126,000 in public funds in the form of three separate deals.

One grant was from the organisation London & Partners for which Johnson was responsible as London mayor - handing her firm £10,000 sponsorship money for an event in 2013.

Today she said she "categorically" did not get the money because of her friendship with Boris Johnson. Instead she said she was chosen for her "big mouth" and tech skills.

Asked if she ever asked for his help to get grants she said: "Categorically no, never."

(Image: Paul Clarke)

One of the trade trips was to Tel Aviv - where she was reportedly allowed to go despite previously being blocked by other City Hall staff. But speaking of a City Hall approver she said: "She didn’t sit me down and let me pass because I was Boris’s friend."

Ms Arcuri also denied the then-Mayor wrote her a letter of recommendation for her application to a £100,000-a-year quango job when she was 27.

She said it was untrue despite putting it on her CV and writing herself in 2014 email: "I still have the letter of rec from Boris. hahaha."

Asked if she was lying in that e-mail, she said today: "Of course!" She added it was a "silly email" that was "playing along" with right-wing provocateur Milo Yiannopoulos.

This breaking news story is being updated.
description: The PM's ex-pal denied getting 'favours' but refused 7 times to tell ITV's Good Morning Britain if they had an intimate relationship - in a jaw-dropping interview that ranged from pole-dancing to trade trips
